fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63645].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

The Fix for [JIM-1731|https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/JIM-1731] has not been included in a JIRA Server Release. Please develop a fix for this for JIRA Server customers experiencing this issue. 

h3. Environment
JIRA 7.X
jira-importers-trello-plugin: 1.5.1

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Attempting to import a trello board in JIRA Server fails with a NullpointerException
{noformat}
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.trello.transformers.CardTransformer.getHistory(CardTransformer.java:521)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.trello.transformers.CardTransformer.importHistory(CardTransformer.java:159)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.trello.transformers.CardTransformer.apply(CardTransformer.java:111)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.trello.transformers.CardTransformer.apply(CardTransformer.java:68)
	at com.google.common.collect.Iterators$8.transform(Iterators.java:799)
	at com.google.common.collect.TransformedIterator.next(TransformedIterator.java:48)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:786)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:414)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:498)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.AopUtils.invokeJoinpointUsingReflection(AopUtils.java:317)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.doInvoke(ServiceInvoker.java:56)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.internal.aop.ServiceInvoker.invoke(ServiceInvoker.java:60)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invokeUnprivileged(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:70)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.util.internal.aop.ServiceTCCLInterceptor.invoke(ServiceTCCLInterceptor.java:53)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.eclipse.gemini.blueprint.service.importer.support.LocalBundleContextAdvice.invoke(LocalBundleContextAdvice.java:57)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.doProceed(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:133)
	at org.springframework.aop.support.DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.invoke(DelegatingIntroductionInterceptor.java:121)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.ReflectiveMethodInvocation.proceed(ReflectiveMethodInvocation.java:179)
	at org.springframework.aop.framework.JdkDynamicAopProxy.invoke(JdkDynamicAopProxy.java:207)
	at com.sun.proxy.$Proxy3494.doImport(Unknown Source)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:453)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:421)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:216)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
The Trello board should be imported successfully. 

h3. Notes
A fix for this specific bug has been provided to Atlassian Cloud. Users experiencing problems with Trello imports on Atlassian Cloud should contact [Atlassian Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Implement fix for Trello Import Failure Bug in JIRA Server
Amend JIRA Agile to JIRA Software in the JIRA Trello Importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63643].
{panel}
h3. Summary

After importing your Trello projects to JIRA, any card attachments linked in Trello are not supported in JIRA and appears as a broken link.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. In Trello, attach a card to an existing card as an attachment.
2. In JIRA settings, import your Trello projects to your JIRA's tenant using the *External System Import* tool.

!test_on_Testing_board_from_Trello_to_Jira_Core_2___Trello.png|thumbnail!
h3. Expected Results

All of your project, issues and card should be imported to your JIRA tenant.

''1 projects and 3 issues imported successfully!''
h3. Actual Results

The attachment is imported to JIRA as an unsupported URL in the issue.

Below is the error is given in the import detailed log:
{noformat}
2017-12-22 08:24:37,536 WARN - Could not download attachment "http://xxxxcloudtest.atlassian.net/browse/TEST-24" for issue "abc": Could not create file.
{noformat}
h3. !External_System_Import_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!   !Testing_board_from_Trello_to_Jira_Core_2__error-_Jira.png|thumbnail! !Testing_board_from_Trello_to_Jira_Core_2_-_Jira.png|thumbnail!  
h3. Workaround

Manually link the card to your JIRA project using *Jira Power-up* in Trello.

To do this you must [link your JIRA account|http://help.trello.com/article/1081-using-the-jira-power-up] in the *Power-Ups* of your Trello.
fields.summary: Trello attachments not supported in JIRA
Error when using Trello importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63640].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Currently importing project with Subtask from Trello using JIRA's External Import will result in following error:

{quote}Could not import checklists: there is no SubTask issue type in the target JIRA project.{quote}

This happens because JIRA's subtask is named *Sub-Tasks*.

h3. Environment
6.4.12 -> JIRA 7.0.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open External System Import in JIRA
# Import Trello Project which contains subtask

h3. Expected Results
All the issues including subtask imported correctly with their respective issue type.

h3. Actual Results
User is prompted with the following error:

{quote}Could not import checklists: there is no SubTask issue type in the target JIRA project.{quote}

h3.Workaround
Create task type Sub-Task with name "SubTask" for the Project imported from Trello
fields.summary: Trello Sub-Task Issue Type
Unexpected failure occured in Trello importer

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63638].
  {panel}

Add special cases when dealing with the Epic issue type.

* If the default/first issue type is Epic, pick another one.
* Don't consider Epic a valid issue type.
* If the only issue type is Epic, display an error.

This is because the Epic issue type is treated in a special way by JIRA Agile (and would mess up the board if we used it).
fields.summary: Handle with the Epic issue type

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63637].
  {panel}

Steps to reproduce:

1. Prepare Trello Instance with project name "ABC&"
2. Create a workflow with name: "Trello Workflow for ABC&"
3. Start a Trello Importer
4. Import project "ABC&"

Exptected behaviour:
Everything is imported correctly, Importer has correctly created new Workflow

Actual:
Importer throws an exception, Workflow is not created
fields.summary: Trello Importer throws Exception when project has a '&' character
It will be great if we have feature of *Manage Attachment View* globally in JIRA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63621].
  {panel}

h2.Summary

In JIRA Service Desk, it is possible to integrate the Confluence knowledge base to the issue navigator but for the issue collector, this is not possible. 

Having the knowledge base on the issue collector will allow user to refer to the documentations before raising issues via the collector; potentially saving customer time. 

It is a good feature to have!
fields.summary: Allow Confluence knowledge base to be embedded into JIRA issue collector

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63618].
  {panel}

# Search for a user with his email as username
 # Click "delete user"
 # If the users has reported issues before a link to the JQL query is displayed. Click the link

=> in the JQL query the username (email) is not enclosed between quotes which means the query does not work

It would be an improvement to enclose usernames with special characters like *@* between quotes or escape them by default for JQL's generated by jira

See screenshots
fields.summary: JQL query from "delete user" link does not encolse username with double quotes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63617].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently when we have a long description or comment in activity tab we can see that there is a button called *show more* to display the rest of the comment or description as shown in the image below:
!showmore.png|thumbnail!

When we click on this show more link/button instead of showing the description or comment on the same activity tab JIRA brings us to the description or comment of the issue. 

h3. Suggested Solution
We have two suggestion solution for this behaviour as mentioned below:
# Display the description/comment on the activity tab when an user click *show more* instead of redirecting them to the description/comment box.
# If displaying the description/comment on the activity tab is not possible then provide a more meaningful name for the link such as *direct to issue* instead of *show more*

h3. Why this is important
The current behaviour is not logical as an user when we saw *show more* button we expect the details to be displayed in the same place instead of redirection.
 
h3. Workaround 

Currently no workaround is available for this behaviour
fields.summary: Provide feature to expand the Show More link in Activity tab for JIRA Issues
Remove isCumulative=false for Created vs Resolved Chart in JIRA
Make possible the use of Iranian calendar
/field/options API endpoints should handle native select field types

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63611].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Audit logs can take a lot of space depending on the size of the instance. Certain users may audit logs for only a few day. However, JIRA can only be configured to have a minimum retention period of 1 month, 

h3. Suggested Solution
Give admins to set the retention period to few days or weeks depending on their need. 

h3. Why this is important
If the customer doesn't require more than a few days, then having audit logs taking much space to store one month of data isn't sensible.
fields.summary: As an Admin, I would like have a shorter retention period for JIRA Audit logs
View screen status in Invision plug-in

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63609].
  {panel}

*+Problem Definition+*
Current behavior with:
Assign Issue Permission - Customer can assign issue via the Assign button, but not the assignee user picker field under People section.

Edit Issue Permission - Customer can assign issue via the assignee user picker field under People section.

*+Suggested Solution+*
Customer would like to be able to assign issue via the assignee user picker field under People section, with only the Assign Issue Permission.
fields.summary: Assign Issue permission to allow issue assignment via the right panel (People)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63607].
  {panel}

*To reproduce*

Create a user in Cloud User Managament

Update his password

Remove all Application Roles

Login in a anonymous window

Expected: Warning about no application access

Actual result: Access to JIRA Welcome Screen, with Login button showing up, but when clicking into it, not able to login again either logout.

– x –

Looks like I'm logged in in Cloud, but logged off in JIRA.
fields.summary: JIRA user without any application role is able to login falling in strange state
As a JIRA project manager I would like to subscribe to receive reports
REST call for  System info details

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63602].
  {panel}

Currently, the description of the "Schedule" issue permission in the scheme is 

*_"Ability to view or edit an issue's due date."_*

This is not complete because the "Schedule" permission is also required for an issue to be moved in the Backlog of the Scrum Board.

From the docs -

_"If you are moving the issue above or below other issues, you will need to have the 'Schedule Issue' permission in the project to which the issue belongs."_

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/agile/jira-agile-user-s-guide/working-with-sprints/adding-an-issue-to-a-sprint]

 

Thus, please update the description of "Schedule" permission in the permission scheme to incorporate the fact that this permission is also used by JIRA Agile in dragging/dropping of issues in the Backlog of scrum board.
fields.summary: Please update description of "Schedule" permission in scheme
Disable opportunity of customer to view all users in autocomplete form on different fields and restrict opportunity of customer to view profile of other users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63600].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
*Add users to a role* feature in the _Users and roles_ page for a project truncates the name due to the small width
!1.png|thumbnail!

In a large organization, it is common to have multiple users with the same Full Name and similar email address. This would cause confusion when trying to add users roles.

h3. Suggestion
Display the full name, email address and username without truncation as per 6.4
!2.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: User's information (full name, email address, username) truncated when adding them to roles
Add Aria tags to HTML export in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63598].
  {panel}

I am considering integrating JIRA service desk our site.I have read [https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-servicedesk/REST/cloud/#authentication/|https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-software/REST/cloud/] and I see that I can use the API to create users, but it does not set their passwords or provide authentication. Ideally, I would like to:
 * create a user in service desk each time a user is created in our system AND have the password be the same
 * when a user clicks on the "help desk" button on our site, they should be directed to JIRA service desk AND logged in to JIRA service desk.

I also noticed that much of the JIRA service desk REST API is still experimental. I am wondering when this will change.
fields.summary: Add passwords and authentication to service desk rest API

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63597].
  {panel}


If a Git commit message precedes the Jira number with a dash '-', the link is not created correctly.

Examples of  'good' commit messages:

My very awesome commit message TADMIN-100
TADMIN-100 My very awesome message
TADMIN-1001 MY message TADMIN-200

Example of 'Bad' commit message:
My very bad message – TADMIN-100
fields.summary: Git - Jira integration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63592].
  {panel}

h3. Environment
* Cloud backup that contains entries like {{assignee=""}}
* JIRA 7.2.6

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Restore Cloud instance to JIRA 7.2.6 staging server to downgrade the data
# Create a backup of the downgraded instance data
# Attempt to restore a single project that has issues assigned to null

h3. Expected Results
# A message alerting us to this condition, along with resolution options is presented

h3. Actual Results
A validation error pops up advising that 1 required user could not be created. Upon clicking the *View Details* option a page will load showing the missing mandatory users, however it is blank.

h3.Workaround
Remove all occurrences of {{assignee=""}} from the backup prior to attempting the project import. 
(!) For nix users the following steps with sed will work:
# Unzip backup file
# Run {{sed -i 's/assignee=""//g' entities.xml}}
# Zip the backup back together {{zip fixed_backup.zip entities.xml activeobject.xml}} 
# Attempt the import

More on this workaround can be found in the following KB article:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Project+Import+Failed+due+to+Blank+Missing+Mandatory+User
fields.summary: Null Assignee Halts Successful Project Import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63591].
  {panel}

h3. Description of problem
The time tracking report requires that the Fix Version field be shown in the field configuration associated with the issues being displayed in the report. This is not mentioned in the documentation.
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira064/time-tracking-report-720416014.html
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver072/reporting-829092747.html
** It appears that the report is no longer documented on a separate page

h3. Suggested Improvement
Update current and older versions of documentation to include that the Fix Version field must be shown in the field configuration in order an issue to appear in the report. 

h3. Workaround
Change the field configuration to show the Fix Version field. If you do not want the field to appear you can remove it from screens.

h3. Additional Information
Versions are a built in component of the Time Tracking Report and the report configuration has a drop down to select version.The report finds issues using a filter. The filter in the background is the following:
{noformat}
(project = 10000) AND (fixVersion is EMPTY) order by remainingEstimate DESC
{noformat}
*  In this case "No Fix Version" is selected. 

The "fixVersion is EMPTY" part excludes all of the issues where the Fix Version field does not apply. These would be issues where the Fix Version field has been hidden in the field configuration.
fields.summary: Time Tracking Report documentation missing fix version field requirement

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63589].
  {panel}

h3. h3. Problem

We need the functionality of making fields required for specific users.

Example:

We want to make the custom field "Potato" for the group of users "administrator" but not for any other groups.
h3. h3. Suggestion

Add an option to make the field required for specific groups
h3. h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Make field required for specific users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63588].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Whenever a backup of the workflow is being saved, the default name is in the format of
{{Copy 1 of workflow 1}}, the naming convention of the backup of the workflows is not helping users to sort the workflows and each copy easily.

All the workflow backups will be listed next to each other because each file name starts with "Copy _ of workflow _". For example,
{quote}
Copy 1 of workflow 1
Copy 1 of workflow 2
Copy 1 of workflow 3
Copy 2 of workflow 1
Copy 2 of workflow 2
Copy 2 of workflow 3
Workflow 1
Workflow 2
Workflow 3
{quote}


h3. Suggestion
It'd be great if the format can be changed and include the current date when the backup is saved, so that all workflows and each backup can be easily identified. For example,
{quote}
Workflow 1
Workflow 1 Copy 1 (13/12/2016)
Workflow 1 Copy 2 (20/12/2016)
Workflow 2
Workflow 2 Copy 1 (13/11/2016)
Workflow 3
{quote}
fields.summary: Change the default format of the backup workflow name
Move "Cancel Re-Indexing" button to opposite end of the status bar
Update the JIRA hardening guide for the most recent versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63582].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When replying to a notification of a specific JIRA issue with Microsoft Outlook or adding a comment through email, a comment is added to the issue, but no notifications are sent to the watchers when the notification scheme is configured properly.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
h5. With Outlook
 # Create a mail handler to a specific project
 # In Issue Commented (Notification Scheme), add a notification to _All Watchers_
 # Create an issue
 # Ensure to set a few users as watchers
 # Send an email out to JIRA's mail handler with the issue key of the step 3
 # A comment is added to the issue
 # No notifications are sent
 # The log files (atlassian-jira-outgoing) show noting even with debug

h3. Expected Behavior

The watchers should receive the notifications properly 
h3. Workaround

Use the web client
fields.summary: Notifications to watchers are not being sent when a new comment is added through an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63580].
  {panel}

+*Issue Summary*+

When a user adds {{jira.issue.editable=false}} to a workflow status, even if they add other workflow properties to the same status, the former would override every other property added to said status.

+*Steps To Reproduce*+

# Create a dummy project with a new workflow.
# In the *closed* status, add the property {{jira.issue.editable=false}}.
# Also add the property {{jira.permission.worklogeditown=true}}
# Create an issue.
# Transition the issue to the *closed* status.
# Attempt to log work.

+*Observation*+

You would not be able to log work because the jira.issue.editable=false has overridden the other property.

+*Feature Request*+

Can the workflow property be enhanced to allow priority to be given to specific properties based on their order?

For example, the highest property takes precedent over others. This would also allow user the opportunity to order their property as they deem fit.
fields.summary: Allow Other Workflow Properties Override jira.issue.editable=false

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63578].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In the iOS JIRA app, when you turn the device to the side, the screen doesn't readjust to the new orientation. The *Boards* menu seems to be the only one that does.

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow for app to be re-oriented when the device is turned.

h3. Why this is important
This makes for easier usage such as when you're using an iPad.

h3. Workaround
The mobile version of the site will allow the page to be re-oriented.
fields.summary: Allow for horizontal orientation
Add the ability to add/update worklogs via REST without sending notifications

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63576].
  {panel}

I write a lot of tickets and spend a lot of time updating and changing those tickets.

Sometimes I hit escape either by accident, by force of habit from years of vim use, or because I think the focus is on a different window.

I often lose a lot of text without JIRA even giving me so much as a "Are you sure you wish to discard your changes? [Discard] [Continue editing]" window.

This happens to me almost every single day and often involves repeating a lot of work.

Please add this confirmation dialog box - I'm certain I'm not the only person this happens to.
fields.summary: Add confirmation box when discarding changes in Jira ticket

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63575].
  {panel}

This issue was logged because it seems to be the fundamental thing in association of Attachments with Comments.  Being able to determine a directly uploaded attachment is also desirable.  None of this is current possible, leaving association down to informed guesswork.

Currently (7.x+) attachment can be uploaded through the Issue screen directly, and the Commenting box.  We need to be able to differentiate these, which is not currently possible.

The 'root' cause of this issue is that there is no association at the entity level between a Comment and an Attachment.  This is a fundamental requirement on which all historic issues that all would need this in order to be satisfied.
 * JRA-1844
 * JRA-17527
 * JRA-27872

Examples of possible workarounds are JRA-43448 to use timestamps to correlate on what attachments were added with a particular comment (unimplemented at this time).
h3. How it could work

a) When the comment is submitted, the comment ID is set on the attachments that were uploaded through it.  

b) When the comment is submitted the comment doesn't initially fire an event.  Attachments that were uploaded during the comment process have their timestamps reset (JRA-43448)

This means that when a Comment event (that usually completes long after attachments have completed upload /creation) occurs, the related attachments can be located.

Attachments uploaded directly are the problem case, as they could not be differentiated between the above.  We'd need to know they were uploaded directly.
fields.summary: Provide a relationship at the data level that an attachment was uploaded via the commenting UI or not
Make done issues visible again : strikethrough of title

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63573].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Solution:
If we refer to the documentation below, the token will expire in 7 days after generated:
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRASOFTWARESERVER072/Allowing+OAuth+access

With a note whether the token expiry is still the same as in the documentation.

h3. Suggested Solution:
To have an option to extend the token expiry for longer use. For example, an option in the "View OAuth Access Token" page accessible from the user profile.
fields.summary: Option to Renew/Extend the expiry of OAuth Token

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63571].
  {panel}

Hi,

Can you _*please*_ mention in your help page on Content Reindexing ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/content-index-administration-148844.html)] that this function is not available to Cloud Confluence subscribers?

I struck a serious problem with Gliffy content today (new bug CONF-45614), for which all self-sourced solutions suggested I start with reindexing content, but no where does it mention (that I could see) that the feature isn't available to cloud subscribers.  Mauro has fixed my problem now with a workaround.

I lost hours today trying to find a way to reindex content in some way and also trying to find another possible solution - all because I was trying to avoid raising a ticket with tech support if a reindex (or another known fix) was all I needed to do.

A quick update to this page would be very helpful, especially when the Status Page [http://status.atlassian.com/] does not get updated for issues like this to explain to customers that a server-side issue exists (it still hasn't been updated) - so customers are just left in the dark.

Thanks.
fields.summary: "Content Reindexing" not available in Cloud Confluence Administration

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63570].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Creating a Linked issue using the *actions* drop down under _Issues in Epic_ will link the ticket back to the Parent Epic ticket and not the Selected issue.
h3. Suggested Solution

Creating a linked issue using the *actions* menu should create a new issue linked to the selected issue and not the parent Epic.
h3. Workaround

Open up the Issue found under Issues in Epic in a new tab > Menu in top right (...) > Create Linked issue
h3. Note

This is happening when creating the links from Parent Task to Sub-Task. See JRA-302080.
fields.summary: Create Linked Issue: should link new issue to the selected issue not the parent epic

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63569].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When proceeding with CSV import with attachments it fails if the attachment contains # on the the starting name of the file.


h3. Environment

* Tested in cloud instance


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a 'CSV' import file with attachments to upload (using 'file://' for JIRA to find attachments under $JIRA_HOME/import/attachments
# Run the .CSV import tool

h3. Expected Results

Issue uploaded with the attachment on it

h3. Actual Results
Issue imported without the attachment and JIRA throws below exception on the import log
{code}2016-12-19 17:54:07,106 WARN - An exception occurred dealing with attachment '19/Dec/16 5:44 PM;sysadmin;export.csv;file://#texto.txt'.
java.io.IOException: Source '/data/jirastudio/jira/home/import/attachments' exists but is a directory
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyFile(FileUtils.java:874)
	at org.apache.commons.io.FileUtils.copyFile(FileUtils.java:835)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.AttachmentImporter.importAttachmentFrom(AttachmentImporter.java:65)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.csv.CsvDataBean.getAttachmentsForIssue(CsvDataBean.java:419)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.csv.CsvDataBean.getAttachmentsForIssue(CsvDataBean.java:382)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.createIssue(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:975)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.importIssues(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:799)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.DefaultJiraDataImporter.doImport(DefaultJiraDataImporter.java:415)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.importer.imports.importer.impl.ImporterCallable.call(ImporterCallable.java:15)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:451)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.TaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(TaskManagerImpl.java:419)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at com.atlassian.jira.util.UnicornOnlyWorkContextCreatingExecutorService.lambda$wrapWithWorkContext$8(UnicornOnlyWorkContextCreatingExecutorService.java:218)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
{code}

h3.Workaround

Manually import the attachments.
fields.summary: CSV Attachment import fails when file starts with '#' (sharp symbol)
Documentation improvement - CSV import

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63563].
{panel}
h3. Problem Definition

When customer is trying to update/edit/create an issue, the following message shows up:
 _Some issue types are unavailable due to incompatible field configuration and/or workflow associations_ ([source|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/some-issue-types-are-unavailable-due-to-incompatible-field-configuration-and-or-workflow-associations-278692623.html])

As a workaround to use the unavailable issue types, users would have to use the MOVE feature.
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be nice to:
 # Be able to edit that error message
 OR
 # Add more details to the user saying that s/he will have to use the MOVE feature
 OR
 # Remove that message at all

h3. Workaround

As a workaround, customers can add a "warning" into the Issue Type field description. To do so you can go to: Issues > Field Configuration > Issue Type > Edit.

Alternatively, change to the [new issue view|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/what-is-the-new-jira-issue-view/].

h3. Notes
This issue is fixed in the [new issue view|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/what-is-the-new-jira-issue-view/]; with the new issue view, when you try to change the issue type, it automatically prompts you into the move operation.
fields.summary: Improve error message on 'Some issue types are unavailable due to incompatible field configuration and/or workflow associations'
Error in documentation: confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-search-for-highly-voted-issues-in-jira-429919103.html
Sync Jira Role with a Confluence Space Restriction List

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63556].
  {panel}

*Problem:*
Both, cache replication and cluster nodes discovery in EhCache are sequential and synchronous.
 Time required to replicate values is proportional to number of nodes in cluster.

com.atlassian.cache.ehcache.replication.rmi.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator is a wrapper for net.sf.ehcache.distribution.RMISynchronousCacheReplicator

We could use RMIAsynchronousCacheReplicator but it introduces numerous problems with backpressure and keeping soft references to objects waiting for replication.

*Solution:*
 Implement semi-async replication where:
 - fire async replication tasks for each node
 - block until all tasks are done

Implement parallel cluster nodes discovery

It would significantly reduce cache replication time for large clusters
fields.summary: Implement semi-async cache replication for EhCache in DC

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63554].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
This is the edge case of JRA-44113.
JRA-44113 has already been closed but the problem sill occurred in the following scenario.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create 15-20 users, ensure all of them are able to be assigned issues (you need enough users to cause the user list in the Assign Issue dialog to have to scroll).
# Assign 2-3 users you created in Step 1 to some tickets to make them appear in *Suggestion* section in the assignee list. (Please check [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/How+are+the+'suggestions'+calculated+in+the+Assignee+dropdown] to understand how the suggestions are calculated.)
(i) Please make sure the 2-3 users are not in the end of *All Users* list.
# Click Assign, then hit the dropdown arrow in the Assignee field.
# Scroll down (using the keyboard or trackpad/mouse, it doesn't matter) to the bottom of the list.

h3. Expected Results
You reach the bottom of the user list and there's no duplicates.

h3. Actual Results
There are some duplicate in the user list.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 
 
h3. Notes
* This isn't browser-specific (I can replicate it in Firefox, Chrome, and Safari)
* This problem is also reproduced when creating an issue

h3.Workaround
Currently there's no workaround, but this issue is purely cosmetic.
fields.summary: Scrolling down list of users in the "Assign Issue" dialog results in duplicate users appearing (Edge case)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63551].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* When the tab Search Issues is accessed through the Navigation Menu, it loads up the default filter ALL which returns all issues accessible to the current user.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Option to configure the default filter, or allow to disable search until user confirmation.

h3. Why this is important
* To reduce possible overload and affect performance, should the event occur when a high number of users access the Search Issues concurrently.
fields.summary: Option to configure the default filter in Search Issues.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63550].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* Currently the session timeout completely removes the session and all unsaved data is lost.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Allow for a window prompt for re-logging in after a session timeout, keeping the previous session.

h3. Why this is important
* Users will not need to lose information through unattended idle. 

h3. Workaround 
* Changing the [Default Timeout Session|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira062/changing-the-default-session-timeout-588581487.html].
fields.summary: Allow re-login using a window prompt after session timeouts, keeping the previous session.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63549].
  {panel}

I had an issue reported to me today, where a team member was not able to change the type of an issue. He was only being given a subset of the available issue type. The reason was the field configuration scheme, the issue type he wished to switch to was using a different field configuration scheme, the only issue types that were visible were those on the same field configuration scheme as the current issue type.

No indication was given as to why only a subset were visible. [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/some-issue-types-are-unavailable-due-to-incompatible-field-configuration-and-or-workflow-associations-278692623.html] This describes the issue in more detail.

The workaround is of course to use the move option instead, but this does not feel very intuitive.

I would suggest that:
 * All available issue types are available in the drop down (either inline ajax editing or the edit dialogue)
 * If switching to a type with a different field configuration scheme
 ** Inform the user of any fields that will lose their values as those fields do not exist on the new scheme
 ** Prompt the user to provide values for any new fields which are required by the new field configuration scheme
fields.summary: Improve support for switching issue types where the switch will also include switching field configuration scheme
Backlog - Active task - add "Active" label if in active sprints
Backlog - Done tasks - color in red to help notice it
Better handling of large CSV imports that cause Out of Memory issues
New format of issues shown in backlog is undesirable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63538].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The Two-Dimensional Filter Statistics gadget drop down menus for the xaxis and yaxis are not alphabetically Sorted, and appear in a randomized order in the selection list.  This makes it difficult to locate desired options, especially if many options are available in the list.
!Screen Shot 2016-12-14 at 11.33.10 AM.png|thumbnail!

h3. Suggested Solution
Sort the menu drop down selectable Options alphabetically
fields.summary: Sort Order For x and y axis drop down menu should be alphabetical
Move ticket identifier back to the left of the backlog

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63536].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
* Comments background is similar, which may make different comments not as distinguishable from one another.

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide option to alternate background color such as greyscale/white between comments.

h3. Why this is important
* Allow comments to be easily distinguishable between comments, especially when an issue has plenty of comments.
fields.summary: Allow comments to be distinguishable by alternating background color between comments

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63533].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
In Confluence, when entering a link "[urlA|urlB]", the expected behavior is for urlA to appear as the link text and takes the user to urlB. This can cause some confusion if it was done by mistake or any malicious intent. 


h3. Suggested Solution
If the *link text* looks like a URL (urlA), it should be forcefully synched with the underlying URL (urlB). So that the *link text* becomes urlB as well, such as seen here "[urlB|urlB]". This is to prevent confusion from occurring, as well as security issues associated with incorrect url redirection.
fields.summary: Link text that look a URL should be automatically synched with the underlying URL

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63532].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

Permission scheme is linking wrong user who had username renamed and the original username is reused by other account.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create a user with username *first*.
# Rename the username to *second*.
# Create another user with username "first" again.
# Go to JIRA permission scheme.
# Grant any permission(single user) to the user *first*.
# Observe the user for that permission - user *second* will be there.

h3. Current Result
User *second* is the one that is linked to the permission.

h3. Expected Result
User *first* should be the one linked to the permission.

h3. Workaround
Rename the username of user *first*
fields.summary: Permission scheme is linking wrong user who had username renamed and reused by other account
Can be closed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63530].
  {panel}

h3. +*Summary*+

@mention is showing "undefined" email address when email visibility is set to Hidden. This is similar to JRA-36758, but this time it affects the @mention rather than Assignee field.
h3. +*Steps to Reproduce:*+
 * Set *User Email Visibility* to be hidden
 ** JIRA Administration > System > General Configuration > User Email Visibility
 * Next, open an issue ticket and @mention an user.
 * You will see that "undefined" is being shown as attached screenshot.

 
h3. +*Expected Results*+

 After setting email visibility to Hidden, it should display in this format "*DisplayName (Username)*". This is the case with JIRA 6.4.x
h3. +*Actual Results*+

It is now being shown in this format "*DisplayName - undefined (Username)*" in JIRA 7.x.
fields.summary: User Email Visibility Hidden Causes @mention to show 'undefined' email address

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63528].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When the Support Tools Plugin has multiple tasks executing, the progress bar can display multiple results incorrectly, or be set to different percentages based on the progress of different jobs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Schedule a log scan
# Create a support zip

h3. Expected Results

The progress bar does not display a mixture of the results.

h3. Actual Results

It does.
fields.summary: When running the Support Zip and Log Analyzer at the same time, the progress bar appears all weird

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63526].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When changing an Issue Type Scheme on a project, if some of the issue types of issues in the project are no longer covered by the new scheme, then a migration of issue types will occur. If there's a very large number of these issues, then the operation can take a large amount of time, which will cause gateway timeouts when using a reverse proxy.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Find a project with the order of 100000s of issues in one issue type
# Create an issue type scheme that does not include that issue type
# Change that project's issue type scheme to the new one not including that issue type, and go through the migration steps

h3. Expected Results

Issue types are migrated without issue.

h3. Actual Results

The URL takes so long to load that it causes gateway timeouts at the proxy server.

h3. Workaround

This workaround may require increasing the maximum number of issues in a bulk operation with the system property jira.bulk.edit.limit.issue.count - note that you may need to test in a staging environment to ensure that the resources consumed by this increase do not cause problems. You may need to perform this in batches rather than all at once, depending on how large the set of issues are that need to be changed.

# Create an issue type scheme that contains the full set of issue types from both your original and desired destination state
# Assign that issue type scheme to the project
# Use a bulk move operation to change the issue type of the affected issues
# Now assign the new issue type scheme to the project, without needing to run through the migration
fields.summary: Issue Type Scheme migration on large number of issues causes gateway timeout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63525].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, support engineers/admins have to check manually if a database is supported by Confluence

h3. Suggested Solution
Implement an automatic Health check to see if the database version version is compatible with that version of the application
fields.summary: Check for supported database version
Introduce a check for plug-ins that failed to enable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63523].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As a JIRA Data Center admin, the only solution to fix a Lucene Search Index consistency problem (The issue index is inconsistent with the database state. Database has (<issue-count-1>) issues but the index has (<issue-count-2>) issues.) is by either re-indexing the node or copying the index from another healthy node:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/healthcheck-lucene-search-indexes-740263412.html

h3. Suggested Solution
The health check should also include the option to fix the inconsistency or at least provide the list of issues affected by this problem. This would help admins to assess the best way to fix the inconsistency (e.g. using a project re-index).
fields.summary: As a JIRA Data Center admin, I'd like to know more details about issues causing the Lucene Search Indexes check to fail

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63522].
  {panel}

h3. Summary

When running the Log Analyzer in Support Tools it does not retrieve the RegEx XML file, so it will not match any KB / bugs.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Schedule the log analyzer when there is a valid result in the logs for JIRA Service Desk (JSD).

h3. Expected Results

Results are returned for JSD.

h3. Actual Results

They're not.
fields.summary: Support Tools Plugin does not download the JIRA Service Desk RegEx file, so does not provide matches for JSD issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63514].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
At the moment, if there are dashboards available for anonymous users, then they don't see these dashboards when they visit the JIRA url. Ideally, these dashboards should show up under the "Dashboards" menu on the top bar.

As a workaround, the administrators have to share the dashboard link via email or other channels to the users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Make the dashboards link show all anonymous access dashboards next to the System dashboard.
fields.summary: As a user, I would want to see the link for the anonymous dashboards under Dashboards menu
Searcher for 'Select list' custom field (Severity)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63510].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Several methods in {{CommentManager}} interface returns a list of comments. However, no sort order is documented. If user wants to sort, they'll have to do so manually

h3. Suggested Solution
Define a sort for methods in {{CommentManager}}

h3. Why this is important
This would greatly help and reduce time/work in plugin development

h3. Workaround 
Retrieve the list using the method and then manually sort the results
fields.summary: Define sort for methods in CommentManager
Error returned from JQL query is misleading

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63505].
  {panel}

Jira Software version: v7.2.6#72008

Steps to reproduce:
 - In Jira Software, navigate to: Administration -> User management -> User Directories
 - Add Directory -> LDAP
 - In the "Configure LDAP User Directory" page, expand the Directory Type

Notice that "FedoraDS" is listed as an option. This should be renamed to "389 Directory Server" or "389DS", if there is a character limit. This is because the project was renamed in 2009: [http://directory.fedoraproject.org/docs/389ds/FAQ/history.html|http://directory.fedoraproject.org/docs/389ds/FAQ/history.html]
fields.summary: FedoraDS in "Configure LDAP User Directory" should be renamed to 389 Directory Server
Delete Confirmation Dialog - Project Deletion

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63502].
  {panel}

+Issue Summary+

When importing a Cloud backup into JIRA Server, the import would fail with the following error:
{code:java}
2016-12-12 12:03:44,578 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR xxxxx 723x638x1 1b1wxhy 80.193.64.226,172.31.12.212 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error during ActiveObjects restore
com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with <unknown plugin>:Error executing update for SQL statement 'ALTER TABLE PUBLIC.AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANGUAGE ADD CONSTRAINT fk_ao_c7f17e_project_language_project_lang_revision_id FOREIGN KEY (PROJECT_LANG_REVISION_ID) REFERENCES PUBLIC.AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANG_REVISION(ID)'
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newImportExportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.onSqlException(SqlUtils.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsForeignKeyCreator.create(ActiveObjectsForeignKeyCreator.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ForeignKeyAroundImporter.after(ForeignKeyAroundImporter.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:69)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:554)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:728)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:324)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:60)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:28)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:157)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:133)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1142)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:617)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:745)
Caused by: org.h2.jdbc.JdbcSQLException: Table "AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANG_REVISION" not found; SQL statement:
ALTER TABLE PUBLIC.AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANGUAGE ADD CONSTRAINT fk_ao_c7f17e_project_language_project_lang_revision_id FOREIGN KEY (PROJECT_LANG_REVISION_ID) REFERENCES PUBLIC.AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANG_REVISION(ID) [42102-185]
	at org.h2.message.DbException.getJdbcSQLException(DbException.java:345)
	at org.h2.message.DbException.get(DbException.java:179)
	at org.h2.message.DbException.get(DbException.java:155)
	at org.h2.schema.Schema.getTableOrView(Schema.java:438)
	at org.h2.command.ddl.AlterTableAddConstraint.update(AlterTableAddConstraint.java:72)
	at org.h2.command.CommandContainer.update(CommandContainer.java:78)
	at org.h2.command.Command.executeUpdate(Command.java:254)
	at org.h2.jdbc.JdbcStatement.executeUpdateInternal(JdbcStatement.java:130)
	at org.h2.jdbc.JdbcStatement.executeUpdate(JdbcStatement.java:115)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingStatement.executeUpdate(DelegatingStatement.java:234)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:34)
	... 18 more
{code}
or
{code:java}
com.atlassian.activeobjects.internal.ActiveObjectsSqlException: There was a SQL exception thrown by the Active Objects library:
Database:
	- name:PostgreSQL
	- version:9.3.14
	- minor version:3
	- major version:9
Driver:
	- name:PostgreSQL Native Driver
	- version:PostgreSQL 9.1 JDBC4 (build 903)
org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: duplicate key value violates unique constraint "AO_60DB71_SPRINT_pkey"
  Detail: Key ("ID")=(<any numbers>) already exists.
{code}
The error is caused because JIRA is trying to create a plugin table that has a constraint when the table providing the constraint does not exist and does not exist in the exported *_entities.xml_* file from Cloud.

!screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

+Environment+
|Database|H2, MySQL, Oracle and Postgres|

(_though looking at this being a constraint issue, it would likely impact all database types_)

+Expected Behavior+

JIRA would import the data with no issues at all.

+Actual Result+

Import would always fail.

+Workaround+
 # Extract the backup file from JIRA Cloud.
 # Open the file {{activeobjects.xml}} in a text editor
 ** You would need an editor that can edit very large files else it would be truncated.
 # Find and remove the line:
{code:java}
<foreignKey fromTable="AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANGUAGE" fromColumn="PROJECT_LANG_REVISION_ID" toTable="AO_C7F17E_PROJECT_LANG_REVISION" toColumn="ID" />
{code}

 # Save the file.
 # Zip the entities.xml and activeobjects.xml files back together.
 # Attempt to re-import.
fields.summary: Cloud Import To JIRA Server Broken

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63501].
  {panel}

In enterprise instances, the number of custom fields and field configurations tend to increase rather fast, easily reaching more than a 1000, and JIRA struggles to handle this, especially in maintaining caches and performing permission checking.

There are some improvements that could be made to better scale on this.

h5. Longer persistence of caching
Populating caches is expensive, as it locks out multiple operations that depend on it. Currently, most of our field caches expire every 30 minutes.

h5. Expensive permission checking

h5. High memory usage
fields.summary: Better scaling of Custom Fields and Field Configurations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63500].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently in JIRA, there will be only 5 issues listed in in the issue linked list. Users would like options to permanently list all the issues linked to the specific issue.


h3. Suggested Solution

Add option to disable the 5 issues limit from Issue page.


h3. Workaround 

* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/57753/is-it-possible-to-change-the-number-of-issue-links-that-display-by-default
fields.summary: Issue Link list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63497].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently it's only possible for each user to set "MY JIRA HOME" by him/herself after login to JIRA, JIRA administrator cannot change this setting for other users nor set a default home page for all the new users.

h3. Suggested Solution
Add an option in *User Default Settings* to allow JIRA administrator to define the default "MY JIRA HOME" page.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA administrator to set default "MY JIRA HOME" for all JIRA users
JIRA Public REST API to Get user details to include the groups, application, and project roles.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63493].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
There is currently no way to automatically add an application e.g. Confluence to use JIRA as a user server.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide a REST API end point for this.

h3. Why this is important
This is useful when using automated tasks or scripts to set up Atlassian Applications with the same user base.
fields.summary: API to register remote application for JIRA user server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63492].
  {panel}

h2. Problem

After import from JIRA Server to Cloud, users cannot login into Cloud instance.

h2. Message: 
+No error is displayed on screen+ Users simply can't access the site

h2. Steps to reproduce
# perform a JIRA import

h2. Expected
Import is successful an users can login

h2.  Result
Import appears to be successful but administrator is logged out and no user can login. Not even sysadmin.
The jira database shows the imported users but they are not in the crowd directory that syncs Cloud applications.
The Crowd db directory is not present in the JIRA DB.


h3. Verification:
Support can run the following query to detect if the site is affected.
{code}
jira_560571=> select * from cwd_directory;
 id |     directory_name      |  lower_directory_name   |      created_date      |      updated_date      | active |           description           |                   impl_class                    |    
            lower_impl_class                 | directory_type | directory_position 
----+-------------------------+-------------------------+------------------------+------------------------+--------+---------------------------------+-------------------------------------------------+----
---------------------------------------------+----------------+--------------------
  1 | JIRA Internal Directory | jira internal directory | 2013-02-28 09:57:51+00 | 2013-02-28 09:57:51+00 |      1 | JIRA default internal directory | com.atlassian.crowd.directory.InternalDirectory | com
.atlassian.crowd.directory.internaldirectory | INTERNAL       |                  0
(1 row)
{code}
There should also appear a Crowd directory that links with the user base in Cloud.

h3. Notes
If a yellow "failed import" message is shown, then it is a different problem. The crowd_directory is also not created when the import fails. This problem is for the import successfully importing JIRA but failing to create the crowd_directory.

h3. Workaround
Support can investigate if the directory can be added manually to fix the problem. Please contact [Cloud Support|https://support.atlassian.com]
fields.summary: Import doesn't sync user directories and users can't access JIRA
Project Prima w Sok Koło

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63488].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Screen scheme audit logging is not captured as per our [Audit Log documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer072/Auditing+in+JIRA+applications] when a project has multiple screen schemes associated with it,

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to any project which has multiple Screen schemes
# Assign a different screen scheme than what is already assigned.
# Go to System > Audit Log and try finding the change.
# 
h3. Expected Results
An entry will appear in the Audit Log for {{scheme added to project}} and/or {{scheme removed}}

h3. Actual Results
No entry appears

h3.Workaround
There is no known workaround for this.
fields.summary: No Screen Scheme Audit Logging for Projects with Multiple Screen Schemes
Add REST API endpoint to trigger filter subscriptions
"Using the issue collector" documentation has a broken link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63481].
  {panel}

h2. *Current Behaviour*

JIRA users are unable to authenticate with JIRA Capture using the
same authentication mechanisms as JIRA. Alternatives for GApps users
are cumbersome to the point of being unmaintainable.
h2. *Requested Behaviour*

Users should be able to authenticate via the same mechanisms in
both applications. Specifically, they should be able to authenticate
via GApps in JIRA Capture. Similarly to the way that JIRA with GApps currently behaves, pretty
sure there is available tooling for extensions to do GApps auth.
fields.summary: Allow user to login with Google Apps in JIRA Capture
Document all possible values returned of /status
Allow admins to login with a user proxy
a

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63474].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition

Currently, if customer added Note in filter sharing with formatted comment like following:

{code:java}
Test.

This is a test.
This is also a test.

* Test 1
* Test 2
* Test 3
{code}

and share it with user, JIRA will send the notification with content like this:

{code:java}
Test. This is a test. This is also a test. Test 1 Test 2 Test 3
{code}


h3. Suggested Solution

Add formatting support for the filter sharing note.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Add formatting support for notes in filter sharing

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-63473].
  {panel}

Hi all,

I want to suggest you to improve JIRA search field if it is possible. I suppose that you already know that it has a lack of finding anything if it is not an identical match, and the case is not ignored too, but I'm not sure do you know how frustrating it can be.

If you maybe have it in your roadmap, I would highly appreciate if you could tell me what JIRA version would contain this fix, so I can update it as soon as you fixed this irritating issue.

Best,
Siniša
fields.summary: Search field improvement
Option to add share note as a comment
Shortcut key to toggle sprints and backlog lists open and closed in the Backlog of a Scrum board
Provide an selection in any filter category to select or unselect all
Provide a free form text gadget
Improve __MSG_gadget documentation with firewalld rules
